trans-unit.source: Handle to parent or owner window

seg-source.mrk: Handle to parent or owner window

target.mrk: Handle to parent or owner window

trans-unit.source: $BS_AUTO3STATE - Creates a three-state check box in which the state cycles through selected, unavailable, and cleared each time the user selects the check box.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_AUTO3STATE - Creates a three-state check box in which the state cycles through selected, unavailable, and cleared each time the user selects the check box.

target.mrk: $BS_AUTO3STATE - Creates a three-state check box in which the state cycles through selected, unavailable, and cleared each time the user selects the check box.

trans-unit.source: $BS_AUTOCHECKBOX - Creates a check box in which the check state switches between selected and cleared each time the user selects the check box.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_AUTOCHECKBOX - Creates a check box in which the check state switches between selected and cleared each time the user selects the check box.

target.mrk: $BS_AUTOCHECKBOX - Creates a check box in which the check state switches between selected and cleared each time the user selects the check box.

trans-unit.source: $BS_AUTORADIOBUTTON - Same as a radio button, except that when the user selects it, the button automatically highlights itself and removes the selection from any other radio buttons with the same style in the same group.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_AUTORADIOBUTTON - Same as a radio button, except that when the user selects it, the button automatically highlights itself and removes the selection from any other radio buttons with the same style in the same group.

target.mrk: $BS_AUTORADIOBUTTON - Same as a radio button, except that when the user selects it, the button automatically highlights itself and removes the selection from any other radio buttons with the same style in the same group.

trans-unit.source: $BS_FLAT - Specifies that the button is two-dimensional; it does not use the default shading to create a 3-D image.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_FLAT - Specifies that the button is two-dimensional; it does not use the default shading to create a 3-D image.

target.mrk: $BS_FLAT - Specifies that the button is two-dimensional; it does not use the default shading to create a 3-D image.

trans-unit.source: $BS_GROUPBOX - Creates a rectangle in which other buttons can be grouped. Any text associated with this style is displayed in the rectangle’s upper-left corner.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_GROUPBOX - Creates a rectangle in which other buttons can be grouped.
Any text associated with this style is displayed in the rectangle’s upper-left corner.

target.mrk: $BS_GROUPBOX - Creates a rectangle in which other buttons can be grouped.
Any text associated with this style is displayed in the rectangle’s upper-left corner.

trans-unit.source: $BS_PUSHLIKE - Makes a button (such as a check box, three-state check box, or radio button) look and act like a push button. The button looks raised when it isn't pushed or checked, and sunken when it is pushed or checked.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_PUSHLIKE - Makes a button (such as a check box, three-state check box, or radio button) look and act like a push button.
The button looks raised when it isn't pushed or checked, and sunken when it is pushed or checked.

target.mrk: $BS_PUSHLIKE - Makes a button (such as a check box, three-state check box, or radio button) look and act like a push button.
The button looks raised when it isn't pushed or checked, and sunken when it is pushed or checked.

trans-unit.source: $BS_DEFPUSHBUTTON - Creates a push button with a heavy black border. If the button is in a dialog box, the user can select the button by pressing the ENTER key, even when the button does not have the input focus. This style is useful for enabling the user to quickly select the most likely option, or default.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_DEFPUSHBUTTON - Creates a push button with a heavy black border.
If the button is in a dialog box, the user can select the button by pressing the ENTER key, even when the button does not have the input focus.
This style is useful for enabling the user to quickly select the most likely option, or default.

target.mrk: $BS_DEFPUSHBUTTON - Creates a push button with a heavy black border.
If the button is in a dialog box, the user can select the button by pressing the ENTER key, even when the button does not have the input focus.
This style is useful for enabling the user to quickly select the most likely option, or default.

trans-unit.source: $BS_BOTTOM - Places the text at the bottom of the button rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_BOTTOM - Places the text at the bottom of the button rectangle.

target.mrk: $BS_BOTTOM - Places the text at the bottom of the button rectangle.

trans-unit.source: $BS_CENTER - Centers the text horizontally in the button rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_CENTER - Centers the text horizontally in the button rectangle.

target.mrk: $BS_CENTER - Centers the text horizontally in the button rectangle.

trans-unit.source: $BS_LEFT - Left-aligns the text in the button rectangle on the right side of the check box.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_LEFT - Left-aligns the text in the button rectangle on the right side of the check box.

target.mrk: $BS_LEFT - Left-aligns the text in the button rectangle on the right side of the check box.

trans-unit.source: $BS_MULTILINE - Wraps the button text to multiple lines if the text string is too long to fit on a single line in the button rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_MULTILINE - Wraps the button text to multiple lines if the text string is too long to fit on a single line in the button rectangle.

target.mrk: $BS_MULTILINE - Wraps the button text to multiple lines if the text string is too long to fit on a single line in the button rectangle.

trans-unit.source: $BS_RIGHT - Right-aligns text in the button rectangle on the right side of the check box.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_RIGHT - Right-aligns text in the button rectangle on the right side of the check box.

target.mrk: $BS_RIGHT - Right-aligns text in the button rectangle on the right side of the check box.

trans-unit.source: $BS_RIGHTBUTTON - Positions a check box square on the right side of the button rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_RIGHTBUTTON - Positions a check box square on the right side of the button rectangle.

target.mrk: $BS_RIGHTBUTTON - Positions a check box square on the right side of the button rectangle.

trans-unit.source: $BS_TOP - Places text at the top of the button rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_TOP - Places text at the top of the button rectangle.

target.mrk: $BS_TOP - Places text at the top of the button rectangle.

trans-unit.source: $BS_VCENTER - Vertically centers text in the button rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_VCENTER - Vertically centers text in the button rectangle.

target.mrk: $BS_VCENTER - Vertically centers text in the button rectangle.

trans-unit.source: $BS_ICON - Specifies that the button displays an icon.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_ICON - Specifies that the button displays an icon.

target.mrk: $BS_ICON - Specifies that the button displays an icon.

trans-unit.source: $BS_BITMAP - Specifies that the button displays a bitmap.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_BITMAP - Specifies that the button displays a bitmap.

target.mrk: $BS_BITMAP - Specifies that the button displays a bitmap.

trans-unit.source: $BS_NOTIFY - Enables a button to send BN_KILLFOCUS and BN_SETFOCUS notification messages to its parent window. Note that buttons send the BN_CLICKED notification message regardless of whether it has this style. To get BN_DBLCLK notification messages, the button must have the BS_RADIOBUTTON or BS_OWNERDRAW style.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_NOTIFY - Enables a button to send BN_KILLFOCUS and BN_SETFOCUS notification messages to its parent window.
Note that buttons send the BN_CLICKED notification message regardless of whether it has this style.
To get BN_DBLCLK notification messages, the button must have the BS_RADIOBUTTON or BS_OWNERDRAW style.

target.mrk: $BS_NOTIFY - Enables a button to send BN_KILLFOCUS and BN_SETFOCUS notification messages to its parent window.
Note that buttons send the BN_CLICKED notification message regardless of whether it has this style.
To get BN_DBLCLK notification messages, the button must have the BS_RADIOBUTTON or BS_OWNERDRAW style.

trans-unit.source: $BS_SPLITBUTTON - Creates a split button. A split button has a drop down arrow

seg-source.mrk: A split button has a drop down arrow

target.mrk: A split button has a drop down arrow

trans-unit.source: $BS_DEFSPLITBUTTON - Creates a split button that behaves like a $BS_PUSHBUTTON style button, but also has a distinctive appearance.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_DEFSPLITBUTTON - Creates a split button that behaves like a $BS_PUSHBUTTON style button, but also has a distinctive appearance.

target.mrk: $BS_DEFSPLITBUTTON - Creates a split button that behaves like a $BS_PUSHBUTTON style button, but also has a distinctive appearance.

trans-unit.source: $BS_DEFCOMMANDLINK - Creates a command link button that behaves like a $BS_PUSHBUTTON style button.

seg-source.mrk: $BS_DEFCOMMANDLINK - Creates a command link button that behaves like a $BS_PUSHBUTTON style button.

target.mrk: $BS_DEFCOMMANDLINK - Creates a command link button that behaves like a $BS_PUSHBUTTON style button.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Control extended style. These correspond to the standard $WS_EX_* constants. See Extended Style Table.

seg-source.mrk: These correspond to the standard $WS_EX_* constants.

target.mrk: These correspond to the standard $WS_EX_* constants.
